title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
વળી પરચા વર્ણવી, કહું હું કાંઈક તેહ<RHYME_207782>; 
હરિ હરિજનના જશ, કહેતાં તે વાધે સનેહ<RHYME_207782>.
gujarati.context:
I'll try to summarize the couplet in 1-2 lines:

"The humble person's good deeds are narrated, and I too have some story to tell; The Lord accepts the devotion of the lowly and it grows into love."
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ડંઢાવ્ય દેશમાં રાજપુરે, કણબી ભક્ત જેકર્ણ<RHYME_207784>; 
સર્વે કુટુંબ સહિત પોત્યે, સ્વામીશ્રીજીને શર્ણ<RHYME_207784>.
gujarati.context: In a distant land of Rajpur, where devotees like me sing; I take refuge with my Lord Shriji along with my entire family.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તેને મહારાજે મોરથી, વર્ષ આગમ જણવી વાત<RHYME_207785>; 
આજ થકી દ્વાદશ માસે, પિંડ થાશે તારું પાત<RHYME_207785>.
gujarati.context: The king will reveal a secret that has been hidden for years, and today marks the start of a new chapter in one's life. In twelve months' time, a person's fate will be decided.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તેને એકાદશ માસ વીત્યા, વળી આવી કહ્યું અવિનાશ; 
ચેતવું હોય તો ચેતજ્યે, રહ્યો મૃત્યુ આડો એક માસ.
gujarati.context: Eleven months passed without him, but his memory remained unchanged; if we remember him, death would seem to be just a month away.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી જેકરણે સતસંગી તેડી, કહી પોતાની વાત નિવેડી; 
ભાઇયો આ તન પામશે નાશ, તેહ આડો રહ્યો એક માસ.
gujarati.context: If you're with good company and share their story, don't interrupt yours; otherwise, your relationship will be destroyed in just one month.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
માટે મંદિર સંત ઊતરવા, કાલ્ય થકી આદરિયે કરવા; 
ત્યારે સતસંગી કહે સારું, અમને કહ્યું એ ન કહેવું બારું.
gujarati.context: The couplet encourages one to take a spiritual journey, rising above worldly desires and leaving behind the attachments of yesterday. One should then share their wisdom with those seeking guidance, but not reveal their own secrets.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી મંદિર સુંદર કરાવ્યું, ત્યાં તો મૃત્યુ તે નજીક આવ્યું; 
ત્યારે પત્ની પોતાનીને કહ્યું, મારે મરવા આડું નવ્ય રહ્યું.
gujarati.context: The beauty of the temple was completed, but then death approached; it was so close that even a newlywed would be advised to die now and avoid further trouble.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
માટે મોર થકી તું તો ચાલ્ય<RHYME_207790>, કેડ્યે હું પણ આવું છું કાલ્ય<RHYME_207790>; 
પછી બેઠી તે કરવા ભજન<RHYME_207791>, આવ્યા નાથ તેડ્યે તજ્યું તન<RHYME_207791>.
gujarati.context: You've left without even saying goodbye, and I'll also return when the time is right. Later, I'll sit with you to reminisce about our past times together.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તેને દેન દઈ ઘેર આવ્યા, પછી મોટા મોટાને બોલાવ્યા; 
ભાઇઓ જુવો પ્રભુનો પ્રતાપ<RHYME_207793>, આ તો વાત મોટી છે અમાપ<RHYME_207793>.
gujarati.context: He who once had nothing has now gained much; let brothers behold God's power, this is a great story indeed.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
મને આવ્યાં છે લેવા વિમાન<RHYME_207794>, બહુ સંત ભેળા ભગવાન<RHYME_207794>; 
મારે જાવું છે કાલ્ય જરૂર<RHYME_207795>, આવ્યું નજીક નથી એ દૂર<RHYME_207795>.
gujarati.context: The divine has arrived as a ferry to take me away; I must depart at night, it's not near but far away.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
માટે સુત એક લઈ સંગે, જાઈશ બ્રહ્મમહોલ ઉમંગે; 
કેડ્યે કહેશો જે ન કહ્યું કેને, નહિ તો પૂછી જોત વાત એને.
gujarati.context: For a moment's pleasure, one should take a leap of faith with friends, and together traverse the vast expanse of life. But if you don't know what to say, then ask and listen attentively to the other's words.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પૂછો જેને પૂછવું જે હોય<RHYME_207797>, કેડ્યે સંશય કરશો મા કોય<RHYME_207797>; 
સ્વામી પોત્યે છે પૂરણબ્રહ્મ<RHYME_207798>, જેને મળ્યે બળે કોટિ કર્મ<RHYME_207798>.
gujarati.context: When you ask the one who is worthy of being asked, your doubts will be cleared by your mother or father; Your Lord has taken on the form of the universe's creator, and when you meet him, countless deeds will be balanced.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કહી તજ્યું પછી તન<RHYME_207791>, જોઈ આશ્ચર્ય પામિયાં જન<RHYME_207791>; 
બોલ્યા માંહોમાંહે એમ વળી, થયો પર્ચો કહે સહુ મળી.
gujarati.context: When one's words are listened to with surprise, it brings fame in the world; this is what people say happens when their words have an impact.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એક કણબી જતન નામ<RHYME_207800>, ભજે પ્રભુ રહે પુરગામ<RHYME_207800>; 
કરે પોતાના ઘરનું કામ<RHYME_207800>, જપે સ્વામિનારાયણ નામ.
gujarati.context: The devotee's name is "one who has taken refuge", and it is said to remain in the Lord's presence forever; the devotee does their own work, and praises Swaminarayan's name.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પાળે સાંખ્યયોગી વ્રતમાન<RHYME_207801>, ધરે પ્રભુ પ્રકટનું ધ્યાન<RHYME_207801>; 
એમ કરતાં આવ્યો તેનો કાળ<RHYME_207802>, આવ્યા તેડવા તેને દયાળ<RHYME_207802>.
gujarati.context: One who leads a virtuous life and pays attention to the Lord's guidance, will attain enlightenment in their lifetime and be blessed with divine compassion.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
જોઈ જતને જોડિયા હાથ<RHYME_207803>, ભલે પધારિયા મારા નાથ<RHYME_207803>; 
કહે નાથ આવ્યા તુજ સારુ, લાવ્યા વિમાન લાખ હજારું.
gujarati.context: When a helping hand is offered, it doesn't matter who gave it; the important thing is that help has arrived. Thousands of planes can bring aid, but a single caring hand is more valuable than all of them.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
બેસ વિમાને મ કર્ય વેલ<RHYME_207804>, કહે એમ એને અલબેલ<RHYME_207804>; 
પછી સંત હતા જેહ સાથ<RHYME_207803>, કરી વિનતિ જોડીને હાથ<RHYME_207803>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

When one's worries are like clouds, don't let them overwhelm; instead, take refuge with someone who can guide you through life.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
આજ દુઃખ કોગળિયા તણું, તેમાં મરે છે માણસ ઘણું; 
તેવામાં મરશે જો આ બાઈ, કહેશે લોક મૂંઈ રોગ માંઇ.
gujarati.context:
Today's troubles are numerous and many people suffer; 
If this person dies, the crowd will say they died of a serious disease.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
માટે એને મૂકી જાઓ આજ<RHYME_207806>, વળી પછી આવજ્યો મહારાજ<RHYME_207806>; 
પછી વિમાનને પાછાં વાળ્યાં, સર્વે ગામને મનુષ્યે ભાળ્યાં.
gujarati.context: Today, let it go silently, Maharaj, and later you will see; after that, the sky turned back, and humans settled all villages.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
જોઈ આશ્ચર્ય પામ્યા છે જન<RHYME_207791>, થયો પર્ચો કહે ધન્ય ધન્ય; 
વળી એક ઉમરેઠ ગામ<RHYME_207800>, દ્વિજ ભક્ત બાઈ જમુના નામ<RHYME_207800>.
gujarati.context: The righteous person who finds joy and surprise in their life, is blessed with gratitude and happiness; their village is adorned with the name of Bhakta Bai Jamuna.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તિયાં પધાર્યા પોતે ભગવાન<RHYME_207794>, દીધાં સહુને દર્શન દાન<RHYME_207794>; 
સાત દિવસ સુધી રહ્યા ત્યાંઇ<RHYME_207808>, પછી આવ્યા પણસોરા માંઇ<RHYME_207808>.
gujarati.context: The devotee has found the divine within themselves and gained spiritual insight; afterwards, they returned to their worldly life in Pansora.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
જમુના બાઈ તો રહ્યા ઝંખતી, જમ્યા વિના ગયા પ્રાણપતિ; 
આકુળ વ્યાકુળ અંતરે થઈ<RHYME_207809>, શરીરની શુદ્ધ ભૂલી ગઈ<RHYME_207809>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet:

The couplet describes how Jamuna Bai, a nameless soul, has gone to heaven without leaving behind any worldly desires or attachments. Her pure inner self has merged with the divine, forgetting the impurities of her physical body.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
અંતર વરતિ ઊતરી જ્યારે, થયું મહારાજનું દર્શન ત્યારે; 
કહે આવ્યા અમે પાછા આજ<RHYME_207806>, કરો રસોઈ અમારે કાજ<RHYME_207806>.
gujarati.context: When the inner self is satisfied, I had the royal vision then; Now that I've returned, ask me to relive that joy again.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
આજ જમવું છે તારે હાથ<RHYME_207803>, કહે જમુનાને એમ નાથ<RHYME_207803>; 
પછી જમુના જાગી તેહ વાર<RHYME_207811>, કરી સુંદર રસોઈ સાર<RHYME_207811>.
gujarati.context:
Today's worries are in your hands, so take care of them; later, you'll realize the beauty of having taken care.

After dealing with today's troubles, you'll find solace and peace.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી આવી જમ્યા જગદીશ<RHYME_207812>, જે કોઈ અનંત શક્તિના ઈશ<RHYME_207812>; 
કરે રસોઈ તે સમે સમે, તેને તજીને જન ઘેરે જમે.
gujarati.context: The divine is always present after it has departed, and its infinite power takes shape in various forms; when it departs, the people are left bereft of joy.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ જમ્યા જમુનાને ઘેર<RHYME_207814>, કરી મહારાજ શ્રીજીએ મહેર<RHYME_207814>; 
પામ્યા આશ્ચર્ય ગામના વાસી, કહે ધન્ય ધન્ય અવિનાશી.
gujarati.context:
As I recall the memories of Jamuna's bank, I adorned my king with royal treasures; 
The villagers were amazed, saying it was a blessing from the eternal and imperishable one.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
આપ્યો પરચો અંતરજામી, સુખદાયી સહજાનંદ સ્વામી; 
વળી મોરજ નામે છે ગામ<RHYME_207800>, તિયાં કણબી પ્રભુદાસ નામ<RHYME_207800>.
gujarati.context: The poet's soul is at peace with God, filled with joy and contentment. The village's name is Mojam, where Prahladdas' name is celebrated.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
આવ્યો તેહના દેહનો કાળ<RHYME_207802>, ત્યાગ્યું તન તેણે તતકાળ<RHYME_207802>; 
ગયો બ્રહ્મમોલમાં તે ભક્ત<RHYME_207817>, તિયાં દીઠા છે અનંત મુક્ત<RHYME_207817>.
gujarati.context: The body's time has passed, and one's soul has been taken away; it is now in Brahmaloka with the devotee, free from worldly bounds.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
દીઠું તેજ ત્યાં અતિ અપાર<RHYME_207818>, જાણ્યું સૂર્ય હજારોહજાર<RHYME_207818>; 
અતિ સુખ સુખ નાવે કહીએ<RHYME_207819>, જાણું અખંડ આ સુખમાં રહીએ<RHYME_207819>.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the joy of being with a loved one as immense, like the infinite number of suns, and says that this blissful state should be cherished and never let go. It emphasizes the importance of appreciating and retaining this happiness.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
દીઠી મહારાજની ત્યાં મૂરતિ, તે તો સુખ સુખમય અતિ; 
લળી લળી લાગ્યો તેને પાય<RHYME_207821>, નીર્ખી હર્ષ હૈયામાં ન માય<RHYME_207821>.
gujarati.context: Where great souls reside, that's where true happiness is; Gazing at them brings joy, but one must not be consumed by it.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી પ્રભુ બોલ્યા એણી પેર<RHYME_207814>, હવે ભક્ત જાઓ તમે ઘેર<RHYME_207814>; 
પછી આવશું તેડવા અમે, ત્યારે આ ધામમાં રહેજ્યો તમે.
gujarati.context: Now that God has spoken, the devotee should go home; we will wait here for your return when the time comes.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
હમણાં તો વળી વહેલા જાઓ<RHYME_207823>, હેતે ગુણ ગોવિંદના ગાઓ<RHYME_207823>; 
પછી ભક્ત આવ્યો દેહ માંહિ, પહોર ચ્યાર લગી રહી ત્યાંઈ.
gujarati.context: In the material world, we should strive to be like God, and then a devotee will enter our mortal body, carrying the divine remembrance with them.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કરી તિયાંની આ સર્વે વાત<RHYME_207785>, સુણી સહુ થયાં રળિયાત<RHYME_207785>; 
કહે જન ધન્ય પ્રભુદાસ<RHYME_207824>, તમે જઈ આવ્યા પ્રભુ પાસ<RHYME_207824>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

This conversation has ended, and our bond has been broken; thank God, we have reached the Lord's doorstep.

(Please note that this is just a brief summary, and the original text may convey more nuance or meaning.)
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પામ્યો પરચો અલૌકિ એહ<RHYME_207825>, તેમાં નથી લગાર સંદેહ<RHYME_207825>; 
વળી ગાના નામે એક ગામ<RHYME_207800>, કણબી ભક્ત અવલબાઈ નામ<RHYME_207800>.
gujarati.context: I have found a rare gem, without any doubt or hesitation; it's a village named after the song, and I'm blessed to be a devotee of Avlabai.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તેણે સુણી સત્સંગીની વાત<RHYME_207785>, માની ન માની રહી મનભ્રાંત<RHYME_207785>; 
પછી આવી દરશન કાજ<RHYME_207806>, નીર્ખ્યા મનમોહન મહારાજ<RHYME_207806>.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes a person who has gained wisdom from their friendships, and later became a sage, capable of understanding the minds of even great kings. Their insightful counsel was sought by many.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
નીર્ખી નાથને પાછી જ વળી, મૂર્તિ મહારાજની ચાલી મળી; 
નયણાં આગળ્યે રહ્યા નાથ<RHYME_207803>, જિયાં જાય તિયાં આવે સાથ<RHYME_207803>.
gujarati.context: Those who haven't experienced the king's divine path must return to their senses, for it is only through this journey that one can meet the true monarch within. The self-realized soul has already reached its destination and will eventually return with the king of the universe as their companion.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ઊઠે બેસે સુવે જાગે જ્યારે, દેખે અખંડ મૂરતિ ત્યારે; 
ખાતાં પીતાં ક્ષણું ન રહે દૂર<RHYME_207795>, હાલે ચાલે ત્યાં દેખે હજૂર<RHYME_207795>.
gujarati.context:
When a moment's pause brings clarity, I see the infinite universe; 
In that instant, time stands still and my soul is nourished.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
બોલતાં બોલે મુખમાં વળી, જોતાં સુણતાં ન રહે વેગળી; 
કરતાં સર્વે ઘરનું કામ<RHYME_207800>, સદા ભેળા રહે તેને શ્યામ<RHYME_207800>.
gujarati.context: A person's words reveal their character in the mirror of their mouth, and if they don't act accordingly, it remains unfinished. One should strive to do good deeds at home, as Shyam always does so diligently.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એ રહ્યું એને બહુ દન<RHYME_207826>, તેનું મહાત્મ્ય ન જાણ્યું મન<RHYME_207826>; 
કહેવા લાગી જેને તેને એહ<RHYME_207825>, પછી મૂરતિ ન દીઠી તેહ<RHYME_207825>.
gujarati.context:
I will remain in this world for a long time, but my importance is not known to anyone's mind; 
One who says they understand me is actually lying, just like the one who pretends to be someone they're not.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ આપે છે સુખ મહારાજ<RHYME_207806>, બહુ પેર્યે કરે જન કાજ<RHYME_207806>; 
વળી પૈજ નામે એક ગામ<RHYME_207800>, કણબી ભક્ત અવલ એનું નામ<RHYME_207800>.
gujarati.context: Sukh Maharaj is the one who brings happiness to people, and with great effort, he accomplishes his goal.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
સાંખ્યયોગી પાળે વ્રતમાન<RHYME_207801>, ભજે પોતે પ્રકટ ભગવાન<RHYME_207801>; 
ધરે ધ્યાન તે પ્રકટ તણું, તેણે કરી ભૂલી પોતાપણું.
gujarati.context:
One who follows the path of self-control and devotion, worships the Lord openly; 

With focused attention, they forget their own ego and worldly desires.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ભૂલી તન બોલી બદલાણી, કહે સેવો મને સ્વામી જાણી; 
વળી પૂછો જે પૂછવું હોય<RHYME_207797>, મને સંશય રાખશો મા કોય<RHYME_207797>.
gujarati.context: Forgetting oneself and speaking of others' wrongdoings is a sign of having realized one's true master; ask me what you will, but I'll keep my doubts hidden from you, mother.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કહે હું સહજાનંદ સ્વામી, સરવેનો છું અંતરજામી; 
એમ કહી પછી માંડ્યું કહેવા, જેને મને હતા ઘાટ જેવા.
gujarati.context: I am a natural joyful soul, filled from within; after speaking thus, I was left breathless, just like those moments that had taken my breath away.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ ઐશ્વર્ય દેખાડે બહુ, જોઈ આશ્ચર્ય પામિયાં સહુ; 
જોજો મહારાજનો પરતાપ<RHYME_207830>, કહે છે યાંથી કહે જેમ આપ<RHYME_207830>.
gujarati.context: This couplet describes the blessings of good fortune that reveal themselves gradually, surprising us with their magnitude. It advises to be patient and let one's greatness unfold as it will, just like a king's reputation grows through his deeds.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ રહ્યું દિન દોય ચાર<RHYME_207831>, પછી ઊપજ્યો એમ વિચાર<RHYME_207831>; 
હું તો દાસ શ્રીમહારાજ કેરી, કેમ બેઠાં આ મુજને ઘેરી.
gujarati.context:
I'll summarize it for you! Here's a 1-2 line summary:

"Just as four days pass and then I am born, so too I ponder on my own circumstances."
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
આવું આસન ન ઘટે મને, એમ કહી લાગી પાય સહુને; 
એહ બાઈની વાત જે કહી, જોજ્યો વિચારી સાંસતાં રહી.
gujarati.context: The couplet says that one's thoughts are not affected by others, and whatever is discussed in the presence of a wise person will be thoughtfully considered and debated.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પળ એક આ દેહ ભુલાય<RHYME_207835>, એવું કોઈ કાળે કેમ થાય<RHYME_207835>; 
મોટો પ્રતાપ આ નાથ કેરો, શું કહીએ તે મુખે ઘણેરો.
gujarati.context: The body will eventually perish, but the secret to its grandeur remains unknown; and if I were to reveal it, my face would be many-told.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
નથી વાત એ લૌકિક લેશ, સર્વે અલૌકિક એ રહસ્ય; 
એમ આપે છે નાથ આનંદ<RHYME_207837>, કહ્યું ન જાય નિષ્કુળાનંદ<RHYME_207837>.
gujarati.context: There is no worldly pleasure; everything is a divine secret. True joy lies beyond words and cannot be expressed.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 141: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī parachā varṇavī, kahu hu kāīk teh; <RHYME_1>
Hari harijannā jash, kahetā te vādhe saneh.  <RHYME_1>
transliteration.context: A beautiful soul is like a colorful thread, weaving together different emotions; their joy and sorrow are contagious and affect those around them.

transliteration.couplet:
Ḍanḍhāvya deshmā Rājpure, kaṇabī bhakta Jekarṇa; <RHYME_2>
Sarve kuṭumb sahit potye, Swāmī Shrījīne sharṇa.  <RHYME_2>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the reverence of a devotee from Rajpur (Rājpure) who has utmost faith in God, considering Him to be their ultimate shelter. This devotion is shared by all members of his family, seeking refuge in Swāmī Shrījīne.

transliteration.couplet:
Tene Mahārāje morathī, varṣh āgam jaṇavī vāt; <RHYME_3>
Āj thakī dvādash māse, pinḍ thāshe tāru pāt.  <RHYME_3>
transliteration.context: The king of the land is my lord, as the monsoon winds arrive with a thousand arms; In this twelfth month, the trees will be decorated with ripe fruits.

transliteration.couplet:
Tene ekādash mās vītyā, vaḷī āvī kahyu Avināsh; <RHYME_4>
Chetavu hoya to chetajye, rahyo mṛutyu āḍo ek mās.  <RHYME_4>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that until the appointed hour of death arrives, one should enjoy life for at least a month. When it is time to depart, death will come regardless of any attempts to delay it.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī Jekaraṇe satasangī teḍī, kahī potānī vāt niveḍī; <RHYME_5>
Bhāiyo ā tan pāmashe nāsh, teh āḍo rahyo ek mās.  <RHYME_5>
transliteration.context: In a good company, even the wind becomes gentle and calm; Brothers, don't worry about anything, just enjoy each other's company for at least a month.

transliteration.couplet:
Māṭe mandir sant ūtaravā, kālya thakī ādariye karavā; <RHYME_6>
Tyāre satasangī kahe sāru, amane kahyu e na kahevu bāru.  <RHYME_6>
transliteration.context:
A saint's temple is not far from home, but to attain divine guidance, one must travel a distant path.
Even when others understand the truth, it takes self-realization to grasp it and remain steadfast.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī mandir sundar karāvyu, tyā to mṛutyu te najīk āvyu; <RHYME_7>
Tyāre patnī potānīne kahyu, māre maravā āḍu navya rahyu.  <RHYME_7>
transliteration.context: The temple's beauty is a reflection of the devotee's good deeds in their previous life, and similarly, one's wife will be as beautiful in their next life as they are now. Just as the temple remains unchanged despite the passing of time, so too does the love between husband and wife endure.

transliteration.couplet:
Māṭe mor thakī tu to chālya, keḍye hu paṇ āvu chhu kālya; <RHYME_8>
Pachhī beṭhī te karavā bhajan, āvyā Nāth teḍye tajyu tan.  <RHYME_8>
transliteration.context:
When the mother's care is the child's wealth, and the home is like a playground; Later, in life, one should worship the Lord with the same playfulness.

(Note: The couplet appears to be expressing the idea that a parent's love and care are crucial for a child's development, and later in life, one should cultivate a similar sense of devotion towards the divine.)

transliteration.couplet:
Tene den daī gher āvyā, pachhī moṭā moṭāne bolāvyā; <RHYME_9>
Bhāio juvo Prabhuno pratāp, ā to vāt moṭī chhe amāp.  <RHYME_9>
transliteration.context: When good deeds are done with a pure heart, even small actions speak loudly. It is because of God's favor that we succeed in our endeavors.

transliteration.couplet:
Mane āvyā chhe levā vimān, bahu sant bheḷā Bhagwān; <RHYME_10>
Māre jāvu chhe kālya jarūr, āvyu najīk nathī e dūr.  <RHYME_10>
transliteration.context: The couplet compares the mind (mane) to a flying palace, where many saints (sant) are pleased with God; yet, it is only a short time until it becomes old and worn out, just like an abandoned palace far away.

transliteration.couplet:
Māṭe sut ek laī sange, jāīsh Brahmamahol umange; <RHYME_11>
Keḍye kahesho je na kahyu kene, nahi to pūchhī jot vāt ene.  <RHYME_11>
transliteration.context: A mother's single complaint is enough to shake the universe, as if Brahma himself were dancing in anger. She doesn't even need to ask anything; just her silence can convey a mighty storm.

transliteration.couplet:
Pūchho jene pūchhavu je hoy, keḍye sanshaya karasho mā koy; <RHYME_12>
Swāmī potye chhe pūraṇ-brahma, jene maḷye baḷe koṭi karma.  <RHYME_12>
transliteration.context:
Ask who you will ask, and don't worry about doubts; 
The Lord is complete Brahman, having performed countless actions for me.

transliteration.couplet:
Em kahī tajyu pachhī tan, joī āshcharya pāmiyā jan; <RHYME_13>
Bolyā māhomāhe em vaḷī, thayo parcho kahe sahu maḷī.  <RHYME_13>
transliteration.context: A person's true nature is revealed only when they are away from their loved ones, and it is a wonder to see the change in people; even if I am far away, my mother's words will always be with me.

transliteration.couplet:
Ek kaṇabī Jatan nām, bhaje Prabhu rahe Puragām; <RHYME_14>
Kare potānā gharnu kām, jape Swāminārāyaṇ nām.  <RHYME_14>
transliteration.context: The devotee's soul is named Jatan, remaining faithful to the Lord as it journeys; they engage in household duties while chanting Swaminarayan's name.

transliteration.couplet:
Pāḷe sānkhya-yogī vratamān, dhare Prabhu prakaṭnu dhyān; <RHYME_15>
Em karatā āvyo teno kāḷ, āvyā teḍavā tene dayāḷ.  <RHYME_15>
transliteration.context: The devotee has a disciplined mind through yoga and meditation, allowing the Lord to reveal Himself. With devotion, one's heart becomes filled with love for God, just as the fire is fueled by the wood placed on it.

transliteration.couplet:
Joī jatane joḍiyā hāth, bhale padhāriyā mārā Nāth; <RHYME_16>
Kahe Nāth āvyā tuj sāru, lāvyā vimān lākh hajāru.  <RHYME_16>
transliteration.context: The one who holds the thread of life with both hands, is fortunate to have a merciful Lord; and if He speaks, even the universe would bow down with humility.

transliteration.couplet:
Bes vimāne ma karya vel, kahe em ene alabel; <RHYME_17>
Pachhī sant hatā jeh sāth, karī vinati joḍīne hāth.  <RHYME_17>
transliteration.context: In the presence of a great soul, one's ego is crushed and humbled. Even the mighty saintly ones show humility in the company of others.

transliteration.couplet:
Āj dukh kogaḷiyā taṇu, temā mare chhe māṇas ghaṇu; <RHYME_18>
Tevāmā marashe jo ā bāī, kaheshe lok mūī rog māi.  <RHYME_18>
transliteration.context: The sorrow will consume me today and my grief will be immense; if you were to die tomorrow, the world would be plagued by a terrible disease.

transliteration.couplet:
Māṭe ene mūkī jāo āj, vaḷī pachhī āvajyo Mahārāj; <RHYME_19>
Pachhī vimānne pāchhā vāḷyā, sarve gāmne manuṣhye bhāḷyā.  <RHYME_19>
transliteration.context: Today's worries will fade away, just like the morning dew before sunrise. In the evening, all our troubles and sorrows will be washed away with the setting sun.

transliteration.couplet:
Joī āshcharya pāmyā chhe jan, thayo parcho kahe dhanya dhanya; <RHYME_20>
Vaḷī ek Umareṭh gām, dvij bhakta bāī Jamunā nām.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context: The couplet praises someone who is considered a wonder by others and asks them to accept their good fortune. The speaker mentions Vaḷī, a devotee of Lord Umareṭh, who is a resident of Jamunā village.

transliteration.couplet:
Tiyā padhāryā pote Bhagwān, dīdhā sahune darshan dān; <RHYME_21>
Sāt divas sudhī rahyā tyāi, pachhī āvyā paṇasorā māi.  <RHYME_21>
transliteration.context: The devotee's feet reach God's presence, and they are blessed with a divine sight; for seven days, their soul remains immersed in joy, and then they return to worldly worries after that.

transliteration.couplet:
Jamunā bāī to rahyā zankhatī, jamyā vinā gayā prāṇpati; <RHYME_22>
Ākuḷ vyākuḷ antare thaī, sharīrnī shuddha bhūlī gaī.  <RHYME_22>
transliteration.context: Without Jamun's presence, life becomes tasteless and colorless; without her love, even the purest of souls is tarnished.

transliteration.couplet:
Antar varati ūtarī jyāre, thayu Mahārājnu darshan tyāre; <RHYME_23>
Kahe āvyā ame pāchhā āj, karo rasoī amāre kāj.  <RHYME_23>
transliteration.context: The queen's beauty is surpassed only by her inner qualities, and she seeks an audience with the king to reveal her true self. She asks why we're delaying and wants to take up her rightful place in the kingdom.

transliteration.couplet:
Āj jamavu chhe tāre hāth, kahe Jamunāne em Nāth; <RHYME_24>
Pachhī Jamunā jāgī teh vār, karī sundar rasoī sār.  <RHYME_24>
transliteration.context: Today's treasure is in someone else's hands, says Lord Jamuna; Tomorrow, I'll wake up and create a beautiful gathering.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī āvī jamyā Jagadīsh, je koī anant shaktinā īsh; <RHYME_25>
Kare rasoī te same same, tene tajīne jan ghere jame.  <RHYME_25>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the love of God (Jagadish) as infinite and all-powerful, which fills one's heart with joy and removes worldly worries. The beauty of this love is beyond human comprehension, making it similar to an endless ocean that overflows with happiness.

transliteration.couplet:
Em jamyā Jamunāne gher, karī Mahārāj Shrījīe maher; <RHYME_26>
Pāmyā āshcharya gāmnā vāsī, kahe dhanya dhanya Avināshī.  <RHYME_26>
transliteration.context: In Jamunāne's house, Lord Shriji is pleased; He is the Lord of the universe, full of mercy.

transliteration.couplet:
Āpyo paracho antarjāmī, sukhdāyī Sahajānand Swāmī; <RHYME_27>
Vaḷī Moraj nāme chhe gām, tiyā kaṇabī Prabhudās nām.  <RHYME_27>
transliteration.context: The soul (āpyo) is the inner essence of God, eternal and joyful; it's like a village called Vali Moraj where the Lord is present in every eye.

transliteration.couplet:
Āvyo tehnā dehno kāḷ, tyāgyu tan teṇe tatakāḷ; <RHYME_28>
Gayo Brahmamolmā te bhakta, tiyā dīṭhā chhe anant mukta.  <RHYME_28>
transliteration.context: The body is a mere shell, and the soul's attachment to it brings only pain; a true devotee of God is beyond all suffering, liberated in eternity.

transliteration.couplet:
Dīṭhu tej tyā ati apār, jāṇyu sūrya hajāro-hajār; <RHYME_29>
Ati sukh sukh nāve kahīe, jāṇu akhanḍ ā sukhmā rahīe.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context: The couplet compares the boundless energy of a soul to the infinite rays of the sun, stating that just as the sun's rays can't be counted, a person's inner peace and happiness cannot be measured.

transliteration.couplet:
Dīṭhī Mahārājnī tyā mūrati, te to sukh sukhmaya ati; <RHYME_30>
Laḷī laḷī lāgyo tene pāy, nīrkhī harṣh haiyāmā na māy.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context: A great queen of the land is one who is humble and content; her happiness is not in showing off to others.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī Prabhu bolyā eṇī per, have bhakta jāo tame gher; <RHYME_31>
Pachhī āvashu teḍavā ame, tyāre ā dhāmmā rahejyo tame.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context: The Lord is calling me to go back to Him, and I should not delay; My true home is with the Divine, where I will forever reside.

transliteration.couplet:
Hamaṇā to vaḷī vahelā jāo, hete guṇ Govindnā gāo; <RHYME_32>
Pachhī bhakta āvyo deh māhi, pahor chyār lagī rahī tyāī.  <RHYME_32>
transliteration.context: Go to the world with a humble heart and sing God's praises; even after surrendering your physical body, spiritual longing remains.

transliteration.couplet:
Karī tiyānī ā sarve vāt, suṇī sahu thayā raḷiyāt; <RHYME_33>
Kahe jan dhanya Prabhudās, tame jaī āvyā Prabhu pās.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summarization of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The devotee's soul is blown away by the divine winds, and it settles at the Lord's feet. The Lord asks why this devotee is so blessed to be united with Him.

transliteration.couplet:
Pāmyo paracho alauki eh, temā nathī lagār sandeh; <RHYME_34>
Vaḷī Gānā nāme ek gām, kaṇabī bhakta Avalbāī nām.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a beautiful garden (Alauki) where one's worries and doubts are washed away like the river Nile, without any hesitation. There is a village called Vaḷī Gānā where a devotee named Avalbāī resides.

transliteration.couplet:
Teṇe suṇī satsangīnī vāt, mānī na mānī rahī man-bhrānt; <RHYME_35>
Pachhī āvī darashan kāj, nīrkhyā man-mohan Mahārāj.  <RHYME_35>
transliteration.context: The devotee's heart is fooled by the illusion of love and attachment, unaware that it's a mere mirage. Then comes the darshan (vision) of the Lord, which awakens the soul and frees it from worldly desires.

transliteration.couplet:
Nīrkhī Nāthane pāchhī ja vaḷī, mūrti Mahārājnī chālī maḷī; <RHYME_36>
Nayaṇā āgaḷye rahyā Nāth, jiyā jāya tiyā āve sāth.  <RHYME_36>
transliteration.context: The lord's beloved is leaving, and the idol of Maharahni (the goddess) has been carried away; only the devotee remains, their life-force spent like a flame that has gone out.

transliteration.couplet:
Ūṭhe bese suve jāge jyāre, dekhe akhanḍ mūrati tyāre; <RHYME_37>
Khātā pītā kṣhaṇu na rahe dūr, hāle chāle tyā dekhe hajūr.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context:
When a person awakens early, they see the world clearly and can distinguish between good and bad; even in chaotic times, one sees their dear ones nearby.

(Note: The Gujarati couplet is likely playing with words, using "akhanḍ" meaning both "clearly" and "distinguished", and "hajūr" meaning both "chaotic times" and "nearby")

transliteration.couplet:
Bolatā bole mukhmā vaḷī, jotā suṇatā na rahe vegaḷī; <RHYME_38>
Karatā sarve gharnu kām, sadā bheḷā rahe tene Shyām.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context: The couplet says that even if one speaks sweet words (bolatā), the listener may not retain their meaning (vaḷī); and similarly, everyone performs rituals (karatā) for worldly desires (gharnu kām).

transliteration.couplet:
E rahyu ene bahu dan, tenu mahātmya na jāṇyu man; <RHYME_39>
Kahevā lāgī jene tene eh, pachhī mūrati na dīṭhī teh.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context: One person's greatness is not recognized by another, and even if it is known, it doesn't make a difference to them. Their own pride and ego are what truly matter, not the recognition from others.

transliteration.couplet:
Em āpe chhe sukh Mahārāj, bahu perye kare jan kāj; <RHYME_40>
Vaḷī Paij nāme ek gām, kaṇabī bhakta Aval enu nām.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The peaceful state of Mahārāj brings happiness to many, and his fame spreads far and wide.

transliteration.couplet:
Sānkhya-yogī pāḷe vratamān, bhaje pote prakaṭ Bhagwān; <RHYME_41>
Dhare dhyān te prakaṭ taṇu, teṇe karī bhūlī potāpaṇu.  <RHYME_41>
transliteration.context: The yogi who has achieved the state of self-realization worships the Lord openly; their mind is absorbed in meditation and they are free from worldly desires.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhūlī tan bolī badalāṇī, kahe sevo mane Swāmī jāṇī; <RHYME_42>
Vaḷī pūchho je pūchhavu hoy, mane sanshaya rākhasho mā koy.  <RHYME_42>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that one should not worry about the consequences of speaking the truth, as it is the path to understanding one's Lord.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahe hu Sahajānand Swāmī, saraveno chhu antarjāmī; <RHYME_43>
Em kahī pachhī mānḍyu kahevā, jene mane hatā ghāṭ jevā.  <RHYME_43>
transliteration.context: The soul is one with the Supreme Being, having no separation between within and without. The mind wanders in search of pleasure, just like a cowherd's cow goes astray from its home.

transliteration.couplet:
Em aishvarya dekhāḍe bahu, joī āshcharya pāmiyā sahu; <RHYME_44>
Jojo Mahārājno paratāp, kahe chhe yāthī kahe jem āp.  <RHYME_44>
transliteration.context: One who sees the prosperity of others with wonder is surprised to find it in their own life too. The greatness of Lord Krishna is beyond human comprehension, and yet people speak about it as if they knew it all themselves.

transliteration.couplet:
Em rahyu din doya chār, pachhī ūpajyo em vichār; <RHYME_45>
Hu to dās Shrī Mahārāj kerī, kem beṭhā ā mujane gherī.  <RHYME_45>
transliteration.context: A person's life is short-lived and fleeting, but their thoughts linger long after; One should focus on pleasing their lord and not worry about their own abode.

transliteration.couplet:
Āvu āsan na ghaṭe mane, em kahī lāgī pāya sahune; <RHYME_46>
Eh bāīnī vāt je kahī, jojyo vichārī sānsatā rahī.  <RHYME_46>
transliteration.context: Someone's absence cannot be filled with mere material things at home; even the wind whispers secrets to those who are patient and contemplative.

transliteration.couplet:
Paḷ ek ā deh bhulāy, evu koī kāḷe kem thāy; <RHYME_47>
Moṭo pratāp ā Nāth kero, shu kahīe te mukhe ghaṇero.  <RHYME_47>
transliteration.context: A person forgets their true self and gets lost in worldly pursuits, until the Lord's reminder comes knocking on their face. The Lord's glory is proclaimed with great pride, and one's mouth is filled with His praise.

transliteration.couplet:
Nathī vāt e laukik lesh, sarve alaukik e rahasya; <RHYME_48>
Em āpe chhe Nāth ānand, kahyu na jāya Niṣhkuḷānand.  <RHYME_48>
transliteration.context: The worldly material world is but a physical shell, while the mysteries of life are divine and eternal. The bliss of the Lord's presence is inexpressible and cannot be described.
